title: Especialista en Estándares de Datos Abiertos en Justicia, USAID JTP
jobDescription:
Dexis is a professional services firm that solves the most pressing social challenges in complex environments, paving the way for a more secure and prosperous world.

Dexis embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion and strives to build and maintain a safe environment where we celebrate diverse backgrounds, treat everyone with respect, and value the unique lived experiences each person brings based on their race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, military or veteran status, national origin, age, marital status or family status and related conditions.

At Dexis, you will experience a corporate culture of inclusiveness, fairness, and trust. You will be given the means and mentorship needed to succeed, and your creativity will be rewarded.

Antecedentes 

Dexis Consulting Group implementa el Proyecto Justicia y Transparencia en Guatemala ejerciendo como contratista de la Agencia de los Estados Unidos para el Desarrollo Internacional (USAID). Este Proyecto tiene como objetivo principal fortalecer las instituciones de justicia y seguridad para que sean más eficientes y efectivas en la investigación, judicialización y penalización del crimen, con el fin de reducir la corrupción y la impunidad en Guatemala.

Objetivo de la consultoría

Apoyo técnico especializado para identificar la situación actual del Instituto de Asistencia y Atención a la Víctima del Delito en cuanto a la publicación de datos en formatos abiertos.

Responsabilidades

El / la consultor/a estará a cargo de ejecutar las siguientes actividades:

Identificar marco legal nacional e internacional que brinden respaldo a la publicación de datos en formatos abiertos.Identificar el tipo de datos que el Instituto de Asistencia y Atención a la Víctima del Delito produce y cual es el nivel de apertura actual de acuerdo con los estándares de datos abiertos y otros parámetros internacionales.Realizar un mapeo del ecosistema de datos del instituto para identificar los distintos roles y de datos abiertos (productores, intermediarios, habilitadores, infomediarios y/o consumidores potenciales o actuales de datos).Establecer el nivel de participación de los integrantes del ecosistema de datos que se prevé en el proceso de apertura.Realizar entrevistas, encuestas y otras técnicas de investigación necesarias para recabar la información.Realizar reuniones y sesiones de trabajo con entidades administrativas y técnicas del instituto de atención a la víctima y personas/organizaciones del ecosistema de datos que sean necesarias para recopilar los insumos.Ubicar las fortalezas y desafíos materiales e institucionales par implementar los estándares de datos abiertos en justicia.Viabilidad de la apertura de datos con especial atención a poblaciones en situación de vulnerabilidad.Realizar un mapeo de los sistemas informáticos en uso para identificar los principales flujos de información.Identificar los recursos, humanos, financieros, ajustes institucionales y demás elementos que permitan la viabilidad de la implementación de los estándares de datos abiertos en justicia.Brindar procesos de sensibilización sobre datos abiertos en justicia para brindar un primer acercamiento especializado al personal clave institucional que formará parte del proceso de implementación de los estándares de datos abiertos en justicia.Realizar las coordinaciones estratégicas y logísticas con el equipo JTP para la realización de las actividades.

Productos/Entregables 

Plan de trabajo, metodología y cronograma de actividades.Informe 1 que indique:Marco legal nacional e internacional que brinden respaldo a la publicación de datos en formatos abiertos.Tipo de datos que el Instituto de Asistencia y Atención a la Víctima del Delito produce y cuál es el nivel de apertura actual de acuerdo con los estándares de datos abiertos y otros parámetros internacionales.Mapeo del ecosistema de datos del instituto para identificar los distintos roles y de datos abiertos (productores, intermediarios, habilitadores, infomediarios y/o consumidores potenciales o actuales de datos).Informe 2 que indique:Nivel de participación de los integrantes del ecosistema de datos que se prevé en el proceso de apertura.Descripción de las entrevistas, encuestas y otras técnicas de investigación necesarias para recabar la información.Descripción de las reuniones y sesiones de trabajo con entidades administrativas y técnicas del instituto de atención a la víctima y personas/organizaciones del ecosistema de datos que sean necesarias para recopilar los insumos.Informe 3 que indique:fortalezas y desafíos materiales e institucionales para implementar los estándares de datos abiertos en justicia.Viabilidad de la apertura de datos con especial atención a poblaciones en situación de vulnerabilidad.Describir el mapeo de los sistemas informáticos en uso para identificar los principales flujos de información.Describir los recursos, humanos, financieros, ajustes institucionales y demás elementos que permitan la viabilidad de la implementación de los estándares de datos abiertos en justicia.Informe 4 que indique:Descripción de los procesos de sensibilización sobre datos abiertos en justicia para brindar un primer acercamiento especializado al personal clave institucional que formará parte del proceso de implementación de los estándares de datos abiertos en justicia.
Localización

El/la consultor/a prestará servicios en la Ciudad de Guatemala.

Nivel de Esfuerzo

40 días

Perfil requerido 

Licenciatura en ciencias jurídicas y sociales, abogacía y notariado o ciencia afín al propósito de la consultoría. Experiencia en temas relacionados con modernización de instituciones de justicia e innovación de servicios públicos.De preferencia con posgrado o conocimientos especializados sobre democracia y datos abiertos; y 10 años de experiencia profesional en alguna de estas áreas.Con experiencia en realizar talleres y capacitaciones a instituciones de justicia y organizaciones de sociedad civil sobre datos abiertosDe preferencia con conocimiento sobre transparencia, acceso a la información pública y justicia abierta.De preferencia haber sido consultor/a en proyectos de cooperación internacional.Ser ciudadano/a guatemalteco/a o contar con los permisos/requisitos legales para trabajar en Guatemala.

Componentes Técnicos

Justicia Abierta y Transparencia

Work Plan Objective

Objective 3: Increase transparency to improve effectiveness and legitimacy.

Supervisor

Open Justice and Transparency Coordinator

Nacionalidad

TCN/CCN

Cómo aplicar

Enviar su CV a icruz@dexisonline.com a más tardar el 23 de agosto de 2024. Favor de indicar la posición en el asunto.

Dexis promueve la igualdad de oportunidad de empleo para todas las personas sin distinción alguna.

Dexis is on a mission to help solve today’s most pressing global political, social, and economic challenges and create a world where all people are safe and prosperous. As a Dexis employee, you will be challenged, empowered, and mentored. Our motto is “find a way or make a way” — that’s how Dexis goes “all in.” How will you?

If you are passionate about this opportunity, apply now! 

Only those applicants who meet the above criteria will be contacted for interview.

Dexis is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, national origin, religion, pregnancy, disability, age, genetic information, military service, veteran status, ethnicity, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, childbirth and related medical conditions, including lactation, or any other protected class under applicable law.

As part of a competitive benefits package for eligible employees, Dexis provides healthcare insurance in addition to other staff welfare benefits and perks.

If you are hired for a position that is paid from the Dexis home office, you will be required to submit proof that you have received the COVID-19 vaccine unless you qualify for a legally recognized medical or religious exception to the vaccine requirement. This does not apply to AL, AZ, FL, KS, MT, NH, ND, or TX residents.

title: Administrador de Bases de Datos Senior
jobDescription:
Importante Empresa De Retail Busca

Administrador de Bases de Datos Senior

Administración de las bases de datos de la organización, asegurando su óptimo rendimiento, seguridad, réplicas, alta disponibilidad y capacidad de recuperación. Responsable de la estrategia y ejecución en la gestión de bases de datos críticas, así como de la implementación de arquitecturas robustas que soporten las operaciones de la organización en un entorno de alta disponibilidad. Además, se encargará de apoyar la integración de soluciones de Business Intelligence para la toma de decisiones estratégicas.

Responsabilidades Principales

Instalar, configurar y gestionar las bases de datos de las cadenas, analizar los impactos previos a cambios a través de pruebas piloto, documentación y procedimientos para mantener datos estandarizados, escalables y seguros.

Ejecutar tareas de mantenimiento para evitar errores en el funcionamiento de las bases de datos.

Desarrollar y mantener la plataforma de inteligencia de negocios, incluyendo el Data Warehouse, diseño de cubos de información, alarmas e interfaces de usuario como dashboards y scorecards.

Elaborar e implementar planes de monitoreo y gestión para prevenir fallos en las bases de datos.

Elaborar planes de respaldo y recuperación ante fallas en colaboración con la Coordinación, definiendo el impacto en la continuidad de los procesos de la compañía.

Desarrollar tareas de tuning (optimización) de bases de datos, mejorando consultas SQL y configuraciones de servidor.

Análisis de Requerimientos.

Requisitos

Educación: Cierre de pensum o título universitario en Ingeniería en Sistemas, Ciencias de la Computación, Informática o carreras afines. Certificaciones avanzadas en bases de datos (como Oracle DBA, SQL Server DBA DESEABLES).

Experiencia

Más de 5 años de experiencia como DBA (Oracle, SQL Server), Analista de Datos o Arquitecto de Modelos de Datos.

Dominio avanzado en lenguajes de bases de datos como T-SQL y PL/SQL, con experiencia probada en la creación de consultas SQL complejas, Store Procedures, Funciones y Packages para entornos de alta demanda.

Gestión de bases de datos, almacenamiento (tablespace, datafile), mdf, export, import (rman).

Dominio de herramientas de Business Intelligence: Integration Services/Data Factory, Analysis Services, Cubos de Información, Power BI.

Sistemas Operativos: Oracle Linux / Windows.

Idiomas: Inglés Intermedio (Indispensable).

Ofrecemos contratación en planilla, modalidad presencial en la zona 10 de lunes a viernes.

title: Ingeniero de datos - Oracle
jobDescription:
Desarrollar, implementar y mantener soluciones basadas en Oracle para apoyar las necesidades de negocio y optimizar el rendimiento de las aplicaciones y bases de datos. Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con equipos de desarrollo y administración de bases de datos para asegurar que las soluciones sean robustas, escalables y eficientes.

Responsabilidades

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener aplicaciones utilizando tecnologías Oracle, incluyendo PL/SQL, Oracle Forms, Oracle Reports, y Oracle Application Express (APEX).

Crear y optimizar procedimientos almacenados, funciones, paquetes y triggers en PL/SQL.

Implementar soluciones de bases de datos eficientes y escalables basadas en los requerimientos de negocio.

Análisis y Diseño

Colaborar con analistas de negocio y usuarios finales para comprender los requerimientos y traducirlos en especificaciones técnicas.

Desarrollar y mantener documentación técnica y de usuario detallada.

Optimización y Rendimiento

Monitorizar y optimizar el rendimiento de las bases de datos y aplicaciones Oracle.

Realizar tuning de SQL y PL/SQL para mejorar la eficiencia y reducir los tiempos de respuesta.

Integración y Soporte

Integrar aplicaciones y bases de datos Oracle con otras tecnologías y sistemas empresariales.

Proporcionar soporte técnico y resolución de problemas para aplicaciones y bases de datos Oracle.

title: Administrador de base de datos - Senior
jobDescription:
Importante Empresa De Retail Busca

Administrador de Bases de Datos Senior con experiencia en Business Intelligence

Propósito General

Liderar la administración de las bases de datos de la organización, asegurando su óptimo rendimiento, seguridad, réplicas, alta disponibilidad y capacidad de recuperación. Responsable de la estrategia y ejecución en la gestión de bases de datos críticas, así como de la implementación de arquitecturas robustas que soporten las operaciones de la organización en un entorno de alta disponibilidad. Además, se encargará de apoyar la integración de soluciones de Business Intelligence para la toma de decisiones estratégicas.

Responsabilidades Principales

Instalación y Gestión de Bases de Datos: Instalar, configurar y gestionar las bases de datos de las cadenas, analizar los impactos previos a cambios a través de pruebas piloto, documentación y procedimientos para mantener datos estandarizados, escalables y seguros.

Mantenimiento de Bases de Datos: Ejecutar tareas de mantenimiento para evitar errores en el funcionamiento de las bases de datos.

Desarrollo y Mantenimiento de Business Intelligence: Desarrollar y mantener la plataforma de inteligencia de negocios, incluyendo el Data Warehouse, diseño de cubos de información, alarmas e interfaces de usuario como dashboards y scorecards.

Planes de Monitoreo y Gestión: Elaborar e implementar planes de monitoreo y gestión para prevenir fallos en las bases de datos.

Respaldo y Recuperación: Elaborar planes de respaldo y recuperación ante fallas en colaboración con la Coordinación, definiendo el impacto en la continuidad de los procesos de la compañía.

Resguardo de Datos: Resguardar y recuperar datos de la organización a partir de respaldos o copias de seguridad periódicas (Rman, import, export (expdp, impdp)), incluyendo backups en frío.

Seguridad y Continuidad: Garantizar la seguridad y respaldo de las bases de datos mediante planes de backups, recuperación ante desastres (DRP’s) y continuidad de negocio (BCP’s).

Optimización de Bases de Datos: Desarrollar tareas de tuning (optimización) de bases de datos, mejorando consultas SQL y configuraciones de servidor.

Análisis de Requerimientos: Analizar los requerimientos de los usuarios para obtener modelos de datos conceptuales y lógicos, contribuyendo a las decisiones del negocio.

Generación de Reportes: Realizar y extraer reportes desde las bases de datos para satisfacer las necesidades de los usuarios y del negocio.

Apoyo a Áreas de IT: Brindar soporte a las áreas de IT (Soporte técnico, Desarrollo, Infraestructura, Coordinación y Gerencia) con conocimientos de bases de datos, incluyendo definición de modelos lógicos, instalaciones y configuraciones.

Control de Réplicas e Integraciones: Validar, controlar y ejecutar medidas correctivas relacionadas con el funcionamiento de procesos de réplicas e integraciones de bases de datos, asegurando la integridad y consistencia de los datos replicados.

Requisitos

Educación: Cierre de pensum o título universitario en Ingeniería en Sistemas, Ciencias de la Computación, Informática o carreras afines. Certificaciones avanzadas en bases de datos (como Oracle DBA, SQL Server DBA) deseables.

Experiencia

Más de 5 años de experiencia como DBA (Oracle, SQL Server), Analista de Datos o Arquitecto de Modelos de Datos.

Dominio avanzado en lenguajes de bases de datos como T-SQL y PL/SQL, con experiencia probada en la creación de consultas SQL complejas, Store Procedures, Funciones y Packages para entornos de alta demanda.

Gestión de bases de datos, almacenamiento (tablespace, datafile), mdf, export, import (rman).

Dominio de herramientas de Business Intelligence: Integration Services/Data Factory, Analysis Services, Cubos de Información, Power BI.

Sistemas Operativos: Oracle Linux / Windows.

Idiomas: Inglés Intermedio (Indispensable).

Competencias Transversales Y/o Estratégicas

Trabajo en Equipo

Enfoque al Cliente

Velocidad

Eficacia

Simplicidad

Competencias

title: Analista de Medios (Mercadeo y Datos) - Digital Media Solutions
jobDescription:
Por favor, adjuntar el CV en INGLÉS.

Buscamos un Analista para unirse a nuestro Equipo de Activación - Digital Media Solutions.

La especialidad de Activación de Ebiquity está formada por expertos que administran y controlan la calidad de los datos. Una parte crítica del papel del Analista es asegurar que los datos se recogen y visualizan con precisión y listos para ser utilizados por el equipo de Client Success.

Principales Tareas

 Establecer relaciones con stakeholders de las agencias de medios y recopilar los datos pertinentes, ya sea directamente de las plataformas o a través de informes compartidos por el equipo de la agencia. Utilizar los dashboards de PowerBI para verificar los datos mensuales de costes y rendimiento en comparación con los informes brutos de la plataforma y garantizar la calidad de los datos. Informar de las anomalías en los datos y ayudar a resolverlas al tiempo que se gestionan los plazos y las expectativas. Coordinarse con otros miembros del equipo, incluidos los Client Partner, Producción y otros Stakeholders internos. Conocer las taxonomías de nomenclatura de las campañas de medios de comunicación y ser capaz de asignar marcas utilizando códigos de identificación de campañas de marcas.

Qué Buscamos

 Licenciatura en Marketing, Publicidad, Economía o campo relacionado; o experiencia laboral profesional equivalente. Se valorará la experiencia laboral relevante en medios digitales y operaciones, pero no es imprescindible. Hablarás inglés y español con fluidez. El inglés es esencial para la comunicación diaria (nivel mínimo de C1 hablado y escrito, se hará entrevista en inglés). Por favor, adjuntar el CV en Inglés. Conocimientos básicos del ecosistema de los medios digitales. Valorable tener conocimiento de herramientas de visualización de datos como PowerBI, pero no es imprescindible. Conocimientos avanzados de MS Excel, incluido el uso de fórmulas avanzadas, funciones de tablas dinámicas y comprensión de otras herramientas de Microsoft Office. Gran interés y pasión por todo lo relacionado con el marketing digital.

Skills

 Atención al detalle: capacidad para detectar errores en los datos para garantizar que los datos finales no contengan errores. Capacidad para realizar varias tareas a la vez con diferentes clientes. Capacidad para trabajar en un entorno de trabajo global y dinámico. Buena comunicación y enfoque proactivo. Automotivación, con capacidad para trabajar eficazmente a distancia.

Lo Que Ofrecemos

 La oportunidad de formar parte del apasionante equipo de Activación dentro de Ebiquity, líder mundial en análisis de inversión en medios. Oportunidad de contribuir significativamente al panorama global de compra de medios digitales y trabajar con algunos de los mayores anunciantes del mundo. Trabajo remoto.

Si quieres conocer más oportunidades laborales de Ebiquity, ¡visita nuestra web!

title: Programs Data Analyst, Guatemala
jobDescription:
Job Title: Program & Data Analyst  

Supervisor: IT Director/Data Analytics Manager

Location: Guatemala

Start Date: ASAP

Contract Type: Consultant with possibility to full time employee

Travel: 20%

About Acceso

Acceso ( www.acceso.org ) is a social enterprise that is revolutionizing food systems in Latin America and the Caribbean to put smallholder farmers first. Acceso’s mission is to create fundamental and lasting positive economic change in the lives of rural smallholder farming families. Our entrepreneurial model provides smallholder farmers with a sustainable way to participate in formalized markets, enabling them to work themselves out of poverty with dignity and to prosper. Acceso currently operates a portfolio of three social businesses in Colombia, Haiti and El Salvador and an agtech tool (Extensio) founded in Mexico. Across our agribusinesses, we have impacted nearly 35,000 smallholder farmers and farm workers, generating more than $80m in farmer income to date.

About This Role

The Sr Analyst, Programs will work with the Program team to launch, support, and analyze Acceso’s operations, utilizing and optimizing the use of Farmforce and Extensio, with a focus on Guatemala. 

Key Responsibilities

The primary responsibilities include:

Acting as the primary liaison between the central data team and local operations.Coordinating all aspects of data management across multiple systems, such as Farmforce, Extensio, Hubspot, Netsuite, Asana, and Power BI.Enforcing best practices for the effective use of these tools at the country level.Overseeing the coordination of data collection, cleaning, analysis, and reporting to ensure operational efficiency and maintain data integrity.

Managing operational and impact data through the Farmforce platform 

Support agronomy and management teams to collect and analyze operational data that helps improve the quality and efficiency of Acceso’s producer support programs, including the preparation of internal and external dashboards/reports to report on key operational metrics and impact indicators. Develop training materials and train technicians’ on how to use Farmforce. Train Program Analysts and other Acceso team members on how to use Farmforce. Support survey design and configuration in Farmforce Support field teams to upload and update new producers in Farmforce Keep Farmer Files updated. Perform data cleaning to align Farmforce and NetSuite farmer data, in coordination with the M&E and data teams. Identify areas for improvement in the use, processes, or design of Farmforce and present them to the Program teams or Farmforce reps for implementation. Stay informed about updates and new features in Farmforce. Continuously assess and propose optimizations to leverage the full potential of the platform. 

Manage Extensio – Acceso’s virtual technical support platform 

Train agronomy and management teams on basic Extensio usage and help them utilize the platform to reinforce the in-person technical training they provide to Acceso producers Create, coordinate, organize and/or execute desired messaging from Program teams to producer networks on good agricultural practices, weather data,, and other topics of interest. Design and execute automatic alerts (droughts, temperature spikes, etc). Oversee rollout of Extensio within Acceso producer network and Extensio partners. Prepare internal and external dashboards/reports to report on key Extensio metrics. Provide feedback highlighting campaign and content effectiveness and other key performance metrics. Support the development of program materials for both internal and external use including presentations, producer training, and donor reports. Support program activities including producer training, technician onboarding, focus groups, surveys, and other activities in the field. Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Farmforce and Extensio setup and ongoing usage Other related tasks as determined by Acceso’s Programs and Data teams 

Qualifications

Engineer degree with a focus on agronomy or agriculture 2 years experience working with rural or low income communities or agricultural based projects in a program design/execution or agronomy role that includes field work  Experience in digital community management, content creation for digital platforms and data analysis  Microsoft Excel  Advanced user of MS Office Suite applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)  Proficiency with Farmforce, or other survey and data management and ag-tech software.  Proficiency in SQL  Mission driven and personal commitment to improving the lives of smallholder farmers. Strong entrepreneurial spirit and business sense. Ability to build trust and positive relationships; collaborative. Highly organized with excellent time management skills. Drive and ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks simultaneously. 

Language skills:  Working fluency in Spanish and English. French is a plus.

Application Instructions

To apply, please submit your CV/Resume and Cover Letter via the form below. For your application to be considered, please submit all materials in English.

For more information about Acceso and careers with us, please visit Acceso.org/careers.

Acceso is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, color, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, HIV/AIDS status, protected veteran status, disability and all other protected classes.

company_data.name: Acceso
company_data.description:
Our vision is a world where smallholder farmers are empowered with long-term opportunities and market access that enable them to live healthy, dignified, and prosperous lives. A world where local food systems are equitable and work in favor of small producers, not against them. A world where all workers in food systems are paid fairly.

Acceso was originally founded by President Clinton and philanthropist Frank Giustra as an initiative of the Clinton Foundation.

Acceso’s mission is to create fundamental and lasting economic change in the lives of rural smallholder farming families. Our pioneering entrepreneurial model provides smallholder farmers with a sustainable way to participate in formalized markets, enabling them to work themselves out of poverty with dignity and to prosper. Acceso focuses on five key initiatives: empowering farmers to improve agricultural production, guaranteeing market access, boosting local social entrepreneurship, improving food security, and market linked reforestation. Acceso’s current social enterprises in Colombia, El Salvador, and Haiti have generated over $60M for more than 15,000 smallholder farmers and farm workers. 

Current portfolio:

Acceso Colombia, the leading Colombian smallholder sourcing business in the Andean and Caribbean regions, supplying national supermarkets, retailers and restaurants.

Acceso El Salvador, the largest smallholder producer sourcing company in El Salvador supplying +60 types of fruits and vegetables, and fish and seafood to the quality markets.

Acceso Haiti, one of few successful social agribusinesses in Haiti that has developed the largest formalized network of small farmers in the country, sourcing peanuts, mango, and moringa for both local and export markets.

Acceso works regularly with leading multinationals such as Pepsi, Unilever, Marriott, Walmart, and Club Med to conduct feasibility studies and pilot programs to expand sustainable sourcing or last-mile distribution opportunities.

Dashboarding skills

jobDescription:
The Company
PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.

We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.

We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.

Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.

Job Description Summary:
What you need to know about the role: Join us as a Data Scientist and collaborate with leaders at Venmo and PayPal to manage loss and drive growth. If you're a rock star at preventing online fraud with a data-driven mindset, capable of enhancing our risk detection capabilities through automation, efficiency, and accuracy in a dynamic environment, this role is for you. Meet our team: Our organization prioritizes developing diverse talent and fostering an inclusive environment where you will be encouraged to align your values with the PayPal Leadership Principles and apply them in your daily role. Our team is committed to PayPal’s Leadership Values and exemplifies:

 Innovation work customer back: create simple and valuable customer experiences. Inclusion Put people first: build the next generation, unlocking their superpowers. Wellness: Work as One PayPal. Collaboration: Win together


Job Description:
Your way to impact:

Your strong analytical skills and proactive attitude will directly impact Venmo by managing and mitigating financial loss from fraud risk, as you work on multiple assignments simultaneously across all areas of related projects.

Your day to day:

Collaboration: Work independently and proficiently on multiple assignments, ensuring high quality and speed and serve as a subject matter expert, mentoring and coaching junior risk analysts or data scientists.

Risk Mitigation: Understand Risk business trends and directions to contextualize work within the broader business landscape. Manage and mitigate Venmo financial loss caused by fraud risk by working on multiple assignments in all project areas.

Data Analysis: Utilize knowledge of internal and external business processes, data systems, flows, analytic tools, processes, and methodologies to achieve results with minimal supervision.

Data Management: Build robust risk anomaly detection systems and critical risk signals to identify fraud patterns at an early stage, seek improvements within defined tasks, evaluate, and execute improvement ideas from supervisor and partner with key stakeholders to design new risk platforms, ensuring better quality of risk strategies.

What do you need to bring:

Communication Skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and understandable manner.

Technical Skills: Strong proficiency in analytical tools and languages such as SQL, Python, Hive, BigQuery, Machine learning and data visualization tools (e.g., Tabeau, Power BI).

Attention to Detail: Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to producing high-quality work efficiently

Education: Master’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Statistics, Mathematics, or closely related quantitative discipline plus two (2) years of experience in or two (2) years of experience in the field of data analysis or statistical analysis

OR bachelor’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Statistics, Mathematics or closely related quantitative discipline plus three (3) years of experience in the or three (3) years of progressively responsible experience in the field of data analysis or statistical analysis

For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.

Our Benefits:

At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

title: Seeds Data Analyst
jobDescription:
Company Description

Syngenta Seeds is one of the world’s largest developers and producers of seed for farmers, commercial growers, retailers and small seed companies. Syngenta seeds improve the quality and yields of crops. High-quality seeds ensure better and more productive crops, which is why farmers invest in them. Advanced seeds help mitigate risks such as disease and drought and allow farmers to grow food using less land, less water and fewer inputs.

Syngenta Seeds brings farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops that can thrive even in challenging growing conditions.

Syngenta Seeds is headquartered in the United States.

Job Description

As the Seeds Data Analyst at Syngenta Flowers, you will play a crucial role in optimizing supply chain data and inventory management. This position involves analyzing inventory levels, goods movement, and capturing data to enhance logistics performance. You will foster collaboration with teams across multiple locations to contribute to a responsive supply chain data management system that prioritizes seed requirements in each market. Key responsibilities include data analysis, stock monitoring, transportation optimization, stakeholder collaboration, identifying process improvements, and ensuring accurate seed reporting.

Key Responsibilities

Inventory Management

Analyze inventory data to ensure compliance with Syngenta's inventory policies, from seed reception to shipping to destination.Monitor stock levels, identify discrepancies, and provide insights to minimize shortages or overages.Conduct regular stock assessments, reconcile with system records, and collaborate closely with the Controlling team.

Logistics Coordination

Analyze transportation and distribution data to optimize logistics processes and ensure timely delivery of products (Seed Products, Tissue Culture Materials, etc.).Collaborate with suppliers, carriers, and internal teams to streamline logistics processes between GT and stakeholders (other sites, hubs, etc.).Utilize data analysis to optimize freight costs while maintaining high service levels.Analyze data related to import and export procedures (taxes, 29-89 decree, bonds, etc.) and align with the Finance team.

Order Fulfillment

Analyze order processing data, from receipt to dispatch, to ensure accuracy and on-time delivery.Work closely with supply planning and production teams, utilizing data analysis to forecast demand and align inventory levels accordingly.Ensure accurate and timely weekly reporting of actual seed results, recording data into the system for stakeholders (Production, NPI's, Management, etc.).

Data Analysis and Reporting

Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources, including supply chain management systems, transportation databases, and warehouse records.Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to provide actionable insights and visualizations for logistics operations.Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for process optimization and cost savings.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.

Qualifications

Qualifications and Skills

Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Operations Research, or a related quantitative field.Experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in logistics, supply chain, Agricultural or a related industry.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets.Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R, Tableau, Power BI).Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.Attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.Advanced Intermediate English Proficiency.

Additional Information

Be part of the Syngenta Experiential Group

Competitive salary and benefits.Dynamic and international environment.Modern, professional, safe and collaborative environment.State-of-the-art employment policies (eg flexible working, focus on goals).Individual development in a diverse and inclusive environment.

Important

Syngenta and its affiliated companies will never request any remuneration for participating in the processes that we publish on our job portal, nor on social networks or job boards with which Syngenta has an agreement.

Beyond believing in the power of diversity, the Syngenta Group promotes an inclusive culture that welcomes differences in all their forms. Here I believe that the feeling of belonging allows people to be the best version of themselves, building an increasingly welcoming and productive environment.

All qualified individuals will be considered for our positions, without regard to race, sex, age, national origin, or disability.

Be part of a leading company that brings the potential of plants to life.

title: Data Scientist - Product
formattedIndustries: Software Development, Financial Services, Technology, Information and Internet
jobDescription:
The Company
PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.

We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.

We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.

Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.

Job Description Summary:
At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We are looking for a Data Scientist for our Xoom Analytics team who goes above and beyond simply providing reports and analyses. This person will need to take end to end ownership on key initiatives and projects. The candidate will also help generate insights by mining Xoom's rich data and support experimentation efforts driven by the consumer product organization. In the process, this person will develop a deep understanding of the Xoom consumer experience, remittance business, our site functionality, further strengthen their analytic skills, and gaining exposure to a wide variety of functional teams within PayPal.

Job Description:
In your day-to-day role, you will: 

Perform deep dive analyses on key business trends from multiple perspectives and package the insights into easily consumable presentationsMake data visually appealing and simple to both navigate and comprehend for end-users.Identify key metrics and drive the building of exec-facing dashboards to track progress of the business and its highest priority initiatives.Identify key business levers, establish cause & effect, and communicate key findings to various stakeholders to facilitate data driven decision-making.Engage in problem solving with Risk, Product, Marketing, and various other teams to determine performance trends and root causes.Support new product launches by establishing test and control plans and ensuring constant monitoring is in place to track product performance.Create close relationships with stakeholders to anticipate & answer questions that might be asked by executives


What do you need to bring: 

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a quantitative field (such as Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or Engineering) or equivalent field experience4+ years professional experience in an analytical roleProficiency with database, spreadsheet, and statistical toolsAdvanced SQL experience, preferable with Big Query analytics (Google Cloud).Expertise in stitching together findings to convey coherent insights, analyzing very large, complex, multi-dimensional data sets.Experience with one or multiple of the following will be highly desirable, Python, Tableau, Jupyter Notebooks, Teradata, Hadoop/Hive, SQL, BigQueryAbility to solve problems analytically and create actionable recommendationsAdvanced ability to use reporting tools like Tableau and/or Excel to share analysisWork experience in the payments, ecommerce, or financial services industry is a plusStrong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to translate complex problems into simpler terms, and effectively influence both peers and senior leadership


Language requirement:

Proficient (B2: Upper-Intermediate) in both written and spoken English. We kindly request that your resume be submitted in English, preferably. 


Workplace Model: 

Hybrid (in-office three days a week). 


Benefits: 

We're committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy at PayPal. We offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health:

Guatemala

Assistance Program, stress management, educational assistance program, and various time off.Christmas Bonus + 14th Bonus (benefits per law).Life and Health Insurance.Cell phone + Parking AllowanceExpert Medical OpinionFamily Healthcare: Major Medical Insurance and DentalFinancial EducationEmployee Stock Purchase Plan.4-week sabbatical after five years of service Life and Disability Insurance 


For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.

Our Benefits:

At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com

Who We Are:

To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.

Belonging at PayPal:

Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.

Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.

Job Description Summary:
What you need to know about the role The GFCCP Fraud Risk Data Scientist is responsible for leading risk strategy framework design and managing end-to-end risk policy for PayPal’s card issuance products. The team is seeking a professional with U.S. and international card risk payments experience to help the team mitigate card fraud losses and improve customer experience. Meet our team PayPal's GFCCP Fraud Risk team is responsible for partnering with global business units to manage a variety of risk of various types, including identity fraud, account takeover, stolen financial fraud, and credit issues. This is an exciting department that plays an important role in contributing PayPal's bottom line financial savings, ensuring safe and secure global business growth, and delivering the best customer experience. This particular opportunity is within the Debit Card Fraud Risk team.

Job Description:
Your way to impact

The primary responsibility of the Data Scientist, Risk Strategy is to help reduce Card losses by developing and optimizing risk strategies throughout the customer lifecycle. A large part of the role is driving business strategy recommendations through data analytics on Card authorization and PayPal customer data.

The data scientist will be cross-functional in scope and will focus on developing innovative card risk solutions while collaborating with key stakeholders in core payments, operations, risk, finance, and product owners.

Your day to day

The individual will:

Develop and optimize risk strategies for PayPal, leveraging knowledge of U.S. or international financial markets, card networks and customer spending behavior.Manage a portfolio of relationships to ensure that payment solutions meet financial and timeline objectives; Creatively leverage partnerships to further PayPal’s strategic business objectives.Develop business cases in support of new risk policies, risk vendor integrations, and PayPal risk infrastructure enhancements.Come up with risk requirements for product initiatives and prioritize said requirements with partner teamsConsult/partner with other PayPal business and technology groups to assure the optimal deployment of payment solutions to satisfy customer needs and corporate objectives. Work with International team members to exchange and implement best practices across PayPal’s existing footprint.


What Do You Need To Bring
4-7 years of experience in payments at an issuer, network, processor, or consultancy. Preference for card network experience. BA/BS from a four-year college or university. MBA a plus. Proven track record of driving results in a fast-paced and constantly changing environmentGood understanding of the applicable laws and regulations that can influence risk and fraud management policyKnowledge and understanding of payment systems, bank credit/fraud policies, structures and operations in relation to card programs Energetic, creative and able to deliver innovative solutions.Must handle multiple priorities with a strong attention to detail and should possess strong analytic and problem solving skills.Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.Demonstrated ability to establish strategic vision and drive change to achieve business objectivesStrong interpersonal skills and ability to build relationships and influence at all levels of managementExperience working externally with third parties who support mission critical processes and deliverablesThorough knowledge of product segmentations, credit/fraud loss activities and key business driversHands on experience with portfolio performance monitoring and diagnosticsProficient in SQL, BigQuery, Python

Millicom (NASDAQ U.S.: TIGO, Nasdaq Stockholm: TIGO_SDB) is a leading provider of fixed and mobile telecommunications services in Latin America. Through our TIGO® and Tigo Business® brands, we provide a wide range of digital services and products, including TIGO Money for mobile financial services, TIGO Sports for local entertainment, TIGO ONEtv for pay TV, high-speed data, voice, and business-to-business solutions such as cloud and security. 

As of December 31, 2023, Millicom employed approximately 16,500 people and provided mobile and fiber-cable services through its digital highways to more than 45 million customers, with a fiber-cable footprint over 13 million homes passed. Founded in 1990, Millicom International Cellular S.A. is headquartered in Luxembourg.

title: Intermediate Data Engineer
jobDescription:
Launchpad, a people-first technology company, is a leader in North America´s rapidly growing tech sector. Through two solutions, Launchpad supports its clients with digital transformation:

PaasportTM, our iPaaS solution, streamlines software integration and automates workflows. Nearshore Staff Augmentation, our managed IT staffing service, connects top IT talent across various geographical regions, bringing industry expertise to leading clients. 

Based in Vancouver, Canada, our operational footprint spans across North and South America, with a second headquarters in Santiago, Chile.

In 2023, our unwavering dedication to innovation garnered recognition as a Deloitte Technology Fast 50™ Program Company. Our clientele boasts industry leaders such as Walmart, GM, TIME Magazine, Salesforce, Tableau, Splunk, Bolt.com, Freedom House, and more.

At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then we’d love to hear from you.

Overview: we are looking for an Intermediate Data Engineer to support the SQL Consolidation program. This role will focus on executing the consolidation plan, providing hands-on technical expertise, and contributing to the overall success of the project.

Please note that 

This job will require your availability from Monday to Friday, 7.30 to 15.30 PSTLength of engagement estimated in 18 monthsEstimated starting date: November 1st, 2024

Responsibilities:

Work closely with the Senior Data Engineer to implement the SQL consolidation plan. Perform hands-on technical tasks, including data migration, transformation, and optimization. Collaborate with the team to troubleshoot issues and ensure project milestones are met. Assist in documentation and reporting related to the consolidation efforts. Support knowledge transfer and training efforts as needed. 

Qualifications:

Solid experience with SQL Server, Azure, and other Microsoft data technologies. Strong technical skills in data migration, ETL, and database optimization. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Effective communication skills, both written and verbal. 

Why work for Launchpad?

100% remotePeople first cultureExcellent compensation in US DollarsHardware setup for working from homeWork with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and AsiaTraining allowancesPersonal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc. ...and more!

At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally.

Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.

title: Senior Data Engineer
formattedIndustries: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting
jobDescription:
🌟 Accomplished Tech Visionary:

Embark on an exciting journey into the realm of software development with 3Pillar! We extend an invitation for you to join our team and gear up for a thrilling adventure. At 3Pillar, our focus is on leveraging cutting-edge technologies that revolutionize industries by enabling data-driven decision-making. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will hold a crucial position within our dynamic team, actively contributing to thrilling projects that reshape data analytics for our clients, providing them with a competitive advantage in their respective industries.

If your passion for data analytics solutions makes a real-world impact, consider this your pass to the captivating world of Data Science and Engineering! 🔮🌐

WE ARE 3PILLAR GLOBAL

At 3Pillar, culture is more than a buzzword. The power of culture, teamwork, and open collaboration drives our commitment to building breakthrough software solutions that power digital businesses. Our passion for software development has gained us recognition in some of the industry’s most innovative spaces, including a spot on the Inc. 5000 list ten years in a row, a three time winner of the Washington Post Top Workplaces Award, and notable features in Forbes, Fortune, and the Washington Business Journal.

We are an innovative software development partner whose solutions drive rapid revenue, market share, customer growth and employee efficiency for industry leaders in Media and Publishing, Information Services, Banking and Financial Services, Insurance and Healthcare.

Our key differentiator is our Product Mindset. Our development teams focus on building for outcomes and all of our team members around the globe are trained on the Product Mindset’s core values – Minimize Time to Value, Solve For Need, and Excel at Change. Our business-minded approach to agile development ensures that we align to client goals from the earliest conceptual stages through launch and beyond.

What We Believe

At 3Pillar, our core values – Intrinsic Dignity, Outsized Impact, Open Collaboration, and Continuous Improvement – drive our commitment to providing best-in-class software development services to high-growth businesses across the globe. We’ve spent more than fifteen years building innovative software solutions. Our executive team has always held our values to the highest standard which has led to active participation on the Forbes Tech Council, a winner of the Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Award, and a spot on the Washington Business Journal’s Women Who Mean Business list.

Key Responsibilities:

A data engineer will design, implement, test, and maintain large-scale data systems, including Data Lakes, Data Warehouses, as well as data ingestion and processing pipelines, work with data manipulation languages, database systems, and APIs for ETL purposes, and follow/enforce Data Governance policies.

Responsibilities

Design, develop, implement and maintain:Data pipelines → Data ingestion.ETL processes → Data processing.DW structures → Data storage.System integration.Design and/or implement big data-oriented architectures for large-scale processing systemsDevelop and maintain documentation including data dictionaries and data lineage related to Data Governance policies.Develop and maintain data quality.Discover opportunities for data acquisition.Analyze data sources(feeds) and data warehouse structures.Deal with raw data that contains human, machine or instrument errors.Testing and maintenance of deployed services.Recommend and implement ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality.

Qualifications

Data-driven problem solver.Computer science basis: Algorithms, Data Structures, Time & Space complexity, Big O Notation, SOLID Principles.Object Oriented Programming (Inheritance, polymorphism, classes, instances, properties, etc.)Hands-on experience with CRUD, ACID and normalization:Hands-on experience with data modeling concepts and techniques:Concepts: Conceptual, logical and physical modeling.

Techniques:

Hierarchical data modelingNetwork data modelingRelational or Entity-relation data modelingRelational database schemas.Dimensional data modeling (Data warehouse schemas)Star and snowflake schemas.Hands-on experience working with unstructured, semi-structured and structured data.Hands-on experience designing, implementing and testing data pipelines.Hands-on experience designing, implementing and testing ETL jobs/processes.Hands-on experience designing database and data warehouse schemas.

Programming Languages & libraries:

Python, Java, R, Scala, Spark, , Go and C++Shell scripting, CRON

Data Pipelines & ETL:

On-Premise: MS SSIS, Informatica Power Center (IPC), Datastage, SAP Data Services.Cloud: Azure Data Factory (ADF), Informatica Cloud Services (ICS), Amazon Glue, Google Data Flow.Streaming: Apache Kafka, Apache Flink, AWS KinesisWorkflow scheduling: Apache Airflow, Oozie, UC4, Control M.

Databases:

Relational: SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL.Non-relational: MongoDB, CassandraGraph: Neo4j, Amazon Neptune, Cosmos DBKey-value: Redis, DynamoDB, Cosmos DB

Data Lake

Hadoop (HDFS)Azure Data Lake Storage

Data Warehouses

PostgreSQLAppliances: SQL MPP, Netezza, Teradata, SAP HanaCloud DW: AWS Redshift, Google Big Query, SQL Data Warehouse, Azure Synapse, Snowflake.

Cloud Storage

AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage

Data Analytics Processing Tools

Azure DatabricksAWS LambdaApache Spark

Benefits

Medical Insurance benefits as per company policy. Life Insurance as per company policy15 days of paid vacation, sick leave and paid holidays as per local lawPaternity and maternity leave as per as per local lawMarriage, bereavement and graduation leaves as per company policySick leave and paid holidays as per local lawChristmas and Middle year bonuses as per local lawMonthly productivity bonus as per local lawDiscounts in local shopsDirect deposit of payroll.Paid professional certifications

What is it like working for 3Pillar Global?

At 3Pillar, we offer a world of opportunity:Imagine a flexible work environment – whether it's the office, your home, or a blend of both. From interviews to onboarding, we embody a remote-first approach. You will be part of a global team, learning from top talent around the world and across cultures, speaking English everyday. Our global workforce enables our team to leverage global resources to accomplish our work in efficient and effective teams. We’re big on your well-being – as a company, we spend a whole trimester in our annual cycle focused on wellbeing. Whether it is taking advantage of fitness offerings, mental health plans (country-dependent), or simply leveraging generous time off, we want all of our team members operating at their best.Our professional services model enables us to accelerate career growth and development opportunities - across projects, offerings, and industries.We are an equal opportunity employer. It goes without saying that we live by values like Intrinsic Dignity and Open Collaboration to create cutting-edge technology AND reinforce our commitment to diversity - globally and locally. 

Join us and be a part of a global tech community! 🌍💼 Check out our Linkedin site and Careers page to learn more about what it’s like to be part of our #oneteam!

title: Senior Data Engineer
jobDescription:
As a Data Engineer part of our growing Data Science team, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining robust and scalable data pipelines, enabling efficient data integration, storage, and processing across our various data sources. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and other technical stakeholders, to ensure data quality and support data-driven decision-making.

Responsibilities

 Develop and optimize scalable, high-performing, secure, and reliable data pipelines that address diverse business needs and considerations.  Identify opportunities to enhance internal processes, implement automation to streamline manual tasks, and contribute to infrastructure redesign.  Act as a guide and mentor to junior engineers, supporting their professional growth and fostering an inclusive working environment.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data quality and support data-driven decision-making to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.  Collaborate with project managers and product owners to assist in prioritizing, 


estimating, and planning development tasks.

 Provide constructive feedback, and share expertise with fellow team members, fostering mutual growth and learning.  Engage in ongoing research and adoption of new technologies, libraries, frameworks, and best practices to enhance the capabilities of the data team.  Demonstrate a commitment to accessibility and ensure that your work considers and positively impacts others. 


Qualifications

 BSc, MSc, and/or PhD in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, CS, or another related subject  Minimum of 4 years of experience in technology-related fields, which can be industry and/or academic research (e.g. BI, Software, Data Science, Data Engineering)  At least 4 years of experience as Data Engineer  Have actively participated in the design and development of data architectures  Hands-on experience in developing and optimizing data pipelines  Experience working with databases and data modeling projects, as well as practical experience utilizing SQL  Effective English communication - able to explain technical and non-technical concepts to different audiences  Experience with a general-purpose programming language such as Python or Scala  Ability to work well in teams and interact effectively with others  Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously while meeting deadlines 


Bonus Points

 Cloud platforms and services, such as AWS, GCP, or Azure  Big data tools such as Hadoop, Spark or Kafka  Orchestration tools such as Airflow  NoSQL databases  Containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes  Agile development environment and familiarity with Agile methodologies 


What’s in it for you:

 Private medical and life insurance from day one  Employee Stock purchase plan ESPP  Budget for professional growth (certifications)  Schedule flexibility.  Extra bonus based on performance. 


Additional Job Description

As a Data Engineer part of our growing Data Science team, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining robust and scalable data pipelines, enabling efficient data integration, storage, and processing across our various data sources. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and other technical stakeholders, to ensure data quality and support data-driven decision-making.

EEO Statement

At TELUS International, we enable customer experience innovation through spirited teamwork, agile thinking, and a caring culture that puts customers first. TELUS International is the global arm of TELUS Corporation, one of the largest telecommunications service providers in Canada. We deliver contact center and business process outsourcing (BPO) solutions to some of the world's largest corporations in the consumer electronics, finance, telecommunications and utilities sectors. With global call center delivery capabilities, our multi-shore, multi-language programs offer safe, secure infrastructure, value-based pricing, skills-based resources and exceptional customer service - all backed by TELUS, our multi-billion dollar telecommunications parent.

Equal Opportunity Employer

At TELUS International, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire and promote, are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

title: Mid-Senior Data Engineer
jobDescription:
We deliver technology to some of the best startups and companies in the world through diverse empowered teams of technologists that want to create change in the digital world.

We are a female-led organization that was created to be a safe place for all people from all areas of life. A place where teams are gender-balanced and compensated equally. And a place where careers are unrestrained regardless of cultural, educational, or geographical background.

We value people with strong technical skills that are collaborative, curious, results-driven, and take ownership. We embrace people that want to be themselves, have daily flexibility, grow, learn, and make a difference wherever the opportunity presents itself.

Technical Skills (Must Haves)

So we hope this sounds like you. Because we are always looking for exceptional Mid-Level or Senior Data Engineers to work in immersive client projects that will challenge your abilities. Ideally, we need you to have advanced level English language skills and:

Technical Skills (nice To Have)

title: Data Engineer
jobDescription:
Launchpad, a people-first technology company, is a leader in North America´s rapidly growing tech sector. Through two solutions, Launchpad supports its clients with digital transformation:

PaasportTM, our iPaaS solution, streamlines software integration and automates workflows. Nearshore Staff Augmentation, our managed IT staffing service, connects top IT talent across various geographical regions, bringing industry expertise to leading clients. 

Based in Vancouver, Canada, our operational footprint spans across North and South America, with a second headquarters in Santiago, Chile.

In 2023, our unwavering dedication to innovation garnered recognition as a Deloitte Technology Fast 50™ Program Company. Our clientele boasts industry leaders such as Walmart, GM, TIME Magazine, Salesforce, Tableau, Splunk, Bolt.com, Freedom House, and more.

At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then we’d love to hear from you.

Please note that this is a 6 to 8 months project, and it requires availability from Monday to Friday, 7.30 am to 3.30 pm PST.

Job Description:

We are seeking a talented Data Engineer to play a key role in our data migration project. The successful candidate will have strong technical skills in Python, SQL, and DBT, and will be responsible for ensuring a smooth transition from our legacy system to the new platform. Experience with Meltano and Snowflake will be considered a plus. Advanced English proficiency is a must, as you will be collaborating with an international team.

Key Responsibilities:

Participate in the migration process from the legacy system to the new data platform. Develop, maintain, and optimize data pipelines and ETL processes using Python, SQL, and DBT. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and ensure seamless integration. Ensure data quality, consistency, and reliability throughout the migration process. Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues during and after the migration. Implement best practices for data governance, security, and compliance. Utilize Meltano and Snowflake to enhance data integration and management processes (nice to have). 

Required Qualifications:

Proven experience of +4 years as a Data Engineer or in a similar role. Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, and DBT. Experience with ETL processes and data pipeline development. Knowledge of Meltano and Snowflake is a plus. Advanced English language skills, both written and verbal. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and communicate effectively with stakeholders. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with data migration projects. Familiarity with data governance and compliance standards. Strong understanding of data architecture and data modeling principles. Experience working in an Agile development environment. 

Why work for Launchpad?

100% remotePeople first cultureExcellent compensation in US DollarsHardware setup for working from homeWork with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and AsiaTraining allowancesPersonal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc. ...and more!

At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally.

Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.

title: Especialista de Cash Flow
formattedIndustries: Food and Beverage Services, Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Wholesale Food and Beverage
jobDescription:

Responsabilidades: Identificar oportunidades de venta de activos improductivos con el fin de encontrar una propuesta favorable para el grupo y contribuir al flujo de efectivo.Coordinar la venta y recuperación del efectivo producto de la transacción.Coordinar el envío de información necesaria para los análisis de otras figuras financieras como Sale and leaseback que puedan identificarse con el fin de obtener una propuesta de parte del proveedor.Realizar el análisis de rentabilidad con el fin de determinar las ventajas y desventajas que significan para el grupo tomar o no un determinado negocio.Tener contacto permanente con los corredores de bienes raíces en las operaciones donde se tengan negocios abiertos.Mantener reuniones constantes con los gerentes financieros y Directores país para definir los objetivos de ventasConsolidar información para presentación de resultados, cierre de mes y SDG FinanzasPreparar información de status mensual de ventas de improductivos y manejo de CAPEX a nivel de ejecución de flujo de efectivo.
¿A quién buscamos? Licenciatura en administración de empresas/ economía o carrera afín.Experiencia laboral de 3 años como Especialista Financiero, Jefe de contabilidad o puestos similares. Bilingüe Excel intermedio/avanzadoConocimiento en SAP, Power Bi y paquete de Office.

company_data.name: bia
company_data.description:
Somos una compañía con enfoque en la industria de alimentos en América. Estamos conformados por tres unidades estratégicas de negocios: snacks, culinarios y café con un portafolio de marcas con amplia trayectoria y valor para nuestros consumidores.

Contamos con un equipo apasionado por conquistar el sabor del mundo, respetando los valores locales de cada marca manteniendo su historia, sabor y tradición. Planteamos objetivos que se centran en nuestro sueño de convertirnos en la compañía de alimentos con las marcas más fuertes de América, llevando la herencia latina a las mesas de más de 300 millones de consumidores, maximizando el valor de la empresa, por lo que estamos en constante crecimiento y expansión geográfica de nuestro portafolio alrededor del mundo.

Nos inspiramos en los grandes retos, ejecutamos con excelencia los procesos, y sobre todo creemos que el trabajo en equipo es la base fundamental para alcanzar los grandes resultados.

Es por esto y mucho más que nos enorgullecemos de nuestra labor, de nuestro equipo y sobre todo de nuestras marcas.

 Desarrollar y gestionar el cumplimiento de los cronogramas de proyectos con todas las áreas. Crear la ficha técnica para pedir presupuestos a pricing. company_data.name: Dichter & Neira
company_data.description:
dichter & neira is a leading market research company that specializes in understanding consumer behavior and purchasing trends, both in modern and traditional channels, by applying cutting-edge technology. 

Our business solutions are built upon four key areas of expertise:

1.	Modern Trade: We analyze all transactions from major retailers using advanced big data technology.

2.	Traditional Trade: We assess and modernize neighborhood stores, collecting extensive daily transaction data at the SKU level.

3.	In-Store Execution: We enhance our clients' execution by providing them with our proprietary Image Recognition Technology algorithm.

4.	Consumer Insights: We gain a deep understanding of consumers' motivations, habits, preferences, and overall satisfaction levels.

We take pride in helping our clients make strategic market decisions through our team of over 450 experienced professionals. 

dichter & neira was founded in 1986 and operates in more than 10 countries across Latin America.

title: Senior Business Analyst
jobDescription:
Launchpad, a people-first technology company, is a leader in North America´s rapidly growing tech sector. Through two solutions, Launchpad supports its clients with digital transformation:

PaasportTM, our iPaaS solution, streamlines software integration and automates workflows. Nearshore Staff Augmentation, our managed IT staffing service, connects top IT talent across various geographical regions, bringing industry expertise to leading clients. 

Based in Vancouver, Canada, our operational footprint spans across North and South America, with a second headquarters in Santiago, Chile.

In 2023, our unwavering dedication to innovation garnered recognition as a Deloitte Technology Fast 50™ Program Company. Our clientele boasts industry leaders such as Walmart, GM, TIME Magazine, Salesforce, Tableau, Splunk, Bolt.com, Freedom House, and more.

At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then we’d love to hear from you.

Position Overview:

The Senior Business Analyst will play a critical role in analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes and systems to meet the needs of our clients. This individual will work closely with stakeholders, gather and document requirements, and translate them into functional specifications. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Salesforce, Web Development and a proven track record of driving successful business outcomes.

Please note that this role requires to work remotly on a Monday to Friday basis, 7.30 am to 3.30 pm PST.

Key Responsibilities:

Requirements Gathering & Documentation: Elicit and document detailed business requirements, translating them into actionable plans for development teams. Scrum Ceremonies: Schedule and facilitate scrum ceremonies (standups, refinement, planning) with the development team, ensuring achievement of session outcomes. Business Process Analysis: Analyze existing business processes and design streamlined workflows to support new service offerings. Customer-Centric Focus: Work closely with end-users to understand their needs, elicit and documentation feedback, and ensure solutions align with their expectations. Technology Integration: Collaborate with development teams to integrate new services into existing systems, including Salesforce and web-based platforms. Project Management: Lead projects related to Recurring Services, ensuring timely delivery and effective communication across stakeholders, including product end users. 

Qualifications:

Skillsets: Strong business acumen, experience with business process analysis, ability to quickly pick up new technologies, keen to introduce new processes, facilitation of scrum ceremoniesPersonality: Quick learner, attentive to detail, proactive, enthusiastic, comfortable with ambiguityExperience: Ideal candidate would have experience with React web development, Salesforce integrations, subscription models, working directly with end-users, web-based customer flows, and inventory management solutions. 

Why work for Launchpad?

100% remotePeople first cultureExcellent compensation in US DollarsHardware setup for working from homeWork with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and AsiaTraining allowancesPersonal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc. ...and more!

At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally.

Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.
